radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are clear. There are no focal hepatic lesions. Gallbladder is normal. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. The pancreas, spleen and bilateral adrenal glands are normal. Kidneys are homogeneously enhancing and excreting urine. There is no evidence of hydronephrosis, stones or masses. There is scattered, non-pathologically enlarged retroperitoneal lymph nodes. There is no mesenteric lymphadenopathy. There is no free air and no free fluid. The esophagus, stomach and small bowel are normal. The distal appendix is dilated, measuring up to 12 mm with a 7 mm obstructing appendicolith noted in the lumen and surrounding fat stranding and peritoneal thickening in the right paracolic gutter, but no evidence of free air or abscess formation. The prostate, seminal vesicles and urinary bladder are normal. There is no pelvic lymphadenopathy. There are no suspicious lytic or sclerotic bony lesions.
